etymology.description: 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") + 飛(飛) (fēi, "fly") = rise up to fly -> take off
etymology.interpretation: The combination of 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") and 飛(飛) (fēi, "fly") conveys the action of an aircraft lifting off the ground to begin flying. This is a straightforward and literal representation of the concept of taking off.

examples.chinese: 飞机在跑道上加速(飛機在跑道上加速)，很快起飞(很快起飛)。
examples.pinyin: Fēijī zài pǎodào shàng jiāsù, hěn kuài qǐfēi.
examples.english: The airplane accelerates on the runway, then takes off quickly.

examples.chinese: 准备完毕(準備完畢)，飞机起飞(飛機起飛)。
examples.english: After getting ready, the airplane takes off.
